<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 117, 379, 143]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 193, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 487, 322]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 338, 228, 353]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 354, 868, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 565, 570, 613]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 99, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 757, 89]]<|/det|> Which measuring instrument can be used to find the volume of a small stone? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 134, 117]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 100, 494, 117]]<|/det|> measuring cylinder partly filled with water <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 127, 134, 144]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 127, 284, 144]]<|/det|> measuring tape <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 134, 170]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 153, 240, 170]]<|/det|> metre rule <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 179, 134, 196]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 179, 235, 196]]<|/det|> protractor <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 222, 97, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 222, 779, 240]]<|/det|> The diagrams show speed–time graphs for four different bodies moving for 6.0 s. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 253, 452, 271]]<|/det|> Which body travelled the least distance? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 280, 806, 720]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 747, 96, 765]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 747, 784, 765]]<|/det|> Which row shows the mass and the weight of an object near the Earth's surface? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 777, 395, 905]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 492, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
A pressure gauge is lowered into the sea. Measurements of the pressure and depth are taken as the pressure gauge is lowered.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 537, 850, 558]]<|/det|>
Which statement describes how and why the pressure changes as the gauge is lowered?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 567, 133, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 567, 700, 586]]<|/det|>
The density of the sea water decreases so the pressure increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 594, 131, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 594, 890, 612]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 620, 131, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 620, 828, 638]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 647, 133, 664]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 647, 747, 664]]<|/det|>

MN
